page.title: 05WATER IN LOUGHBOROUGH
page.content: The water in our area consists of the streams,ponds,a reservoir,springs, wells and a disused canal.This is the water we can see.The other water in our area is either stored in the soil or moves in pipes under the fields and roads.Much of the water in the streams drains from the high ground of Charnwood Forest.The most important brook is called Wood Brook.Three brooks Burleigh,Pocket Gate and Wood Brook are tributaries of the River Soar.Shortcliff Brook flows into the quarry and another brook flows into Blackbrook Reservoir.Six ponds are provided by farmers for animals drinking water.Nanpantan Reservoir is filled with water from Blackbrook Reservoir and sometimes from Wood Brook.There is also a disused canal, two wells and two springs.The water from our taps comes from the R.Dove.
